alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Louisa and Fluvanna Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Orange to near Lake Monticello. Movement was east southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 45 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Mineral, Palmyra, Fork Union, Lake Monticello, Columbia, Ferncliff, Boswells Tavern, Kents Store, Troy, Gordonsville, Louisa Airport, Green Springs, Central Plains, Waldrop, Trevilians, Wares Crossroads, Wilmington, Cunningham and Dixie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
